title: Could not autodiscover on private network with bootnode
body:
Hi there,

please note that this is an issue tracker reserved for bug reports and feature requests.

For general questions please use the gitter channel or the Ethereum stack exchange at https://ethereum.stackexchange.com.

#### System information

Geth version: Geth
Version: 1.7.3-stable
Git Commit: 4bb3c89d44e372e6a9ab85a8be0c9345265c763a
OS & Version: Linux

#### Expected behaviour

Geth connects to bootnode running on the same machine on private network with custom genesis block and waits peer to connect. It should not try to connect to another bootnodes or another peers which is not in my network.

#### Actual behaviour

I have server at DO which has static IP where I've run my private network. But geth permanently try to connect to unknown nodes. Bootnode got pings from geth. Local peer doesn't see remote in `admin.peers` when connecting with proper bootnodes address. Event two peers running in the same machine doesn't see each other.

I expect server's peer not to connect to any other peer except of my local. I expect bootnode log more information about what's going on. 

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

1. Create new genesys.block with network id 142857000000
2. Generate bootnode key: `bootnode --genkey=boot.key`
3. Start bootnode: `bootnode --nodekey=boot.key`
4. Copy enode from stdout and replace `[::]` with actual IP.
5. Run `geth --bootnodes "enode://..." --verbosity 5`

a firewall solve the problem of visitors

iptables -A INPUT -p udp -s $vpsout --dport 30303 -m conntrack --ctstate NEW,ESTABLISHED -j ACCEPT   #alpha/alpha in
iptables -A OUTPUT -p udp --sport 30303 -d $vpsout -m conntrack --ctstate ESTABLISHED -j ACCEPT      #alpha/alpha out
iptables -A INPUT -p udp -s $homeip --dport 30303 -m conntrack --ctstate NEW,ESTABLISHED -j ACCEPT #home/alpha in
iptables -A OUTPUT -p udp --sport 30303 -d $homeip -m conntrack --ctstate ESTABLISHED -j ACCEPT    #alpha/home out
